definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: We thank many listeners who write to us and encourage us.
sentences.chinese: 很感谢有不少听友写信来给我们，鼓励我们。

sentences.english: And listeners can communicate with us by letter ore-mail.
sentences.chinese: 听友你们可以用信件或电邮与我们联系。

sentences.english: Listener friends, we spend time cleaning our body.
sentences.chinese: 听友，我们花时间清洁身体。

sentences.english: Please know that we want to become your friends.
sentences.chinese: 如果听友你还没有机会写信给我们。

sentences.english: Mark, I am sure the listener is very confused.
sentences.chinese: 听友你一定听得很糊涂，对吧？
听友你一定听得很糊涂，对吧？

sentences.english: Wen-J, guess what? I received several letters from the listeners.
sentences.chinese: 马可老师收到好几封听友写给他的信。

definition: regular column or segment (in a publication or broadcast program)/program (TV or radio)
to leave a message/to leave one's comments/message
private correspondence/personal letter/(computing) personal message (PM)/to message sb
to submit articles for publication/to contribute (writing)
to share (let others have some of sth good)
